home | workshop

Processing Community Day @ Delhi

DATE & VENUE

SUNDAY, 27/01/2019

timeblur Studio, Vashant Kunj, New Delhi

SCHEDULE [10 AM - 6 PM]

  • Welcome & introduction [30 min]
    • Software art and its history.
    • Some great works from the software community for inspiration.
    • Introducing the language “Processing”, creators and its purpose.
    • Future scope for the software art community and Its implications.
  • Organizers show [60 min]
    • Natasha Singh : Computational ethnography
    • Dr Mitali Mukerji & Rintu Kutum : Interactive Visualization of Largescale Genomics datasets for P4 Medicine
    • Samarth: Generative art
  • Beginner-friendly workshop I [120 mins]

Lunch break [60 min]

  • Beginner-friendly workshop II [90 min]

  • Wrap-up: discuss ways for the community to go forward and group picture!

Goals

Expectations

Syllabus

ORGANIZERS

Natasha Singh, Co-founder & Director timeblur Studio

Mike, Co-founder & Developer timeblur Studio

Rintu Kutum, PhD scholar, Computational Biology

Sandip Baidya, BTech, IIIT-Delhi

Kadambini, Artist & Designer

Samarth Gulati, UI Designer & Developer
